meanings.definition: Become fully aware of (something) as a fact; understand clearly.
meanings.sent1: She realised she forgot her lunch at home.
meanings.sent2: He finally realised the importance of studying for exams.
meanings.sent3: The cat realised the toy mouse was not real and lost interest.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, she realised the day had slipped away.
meanings.sent5: In the quiet of the library, he realised the answer to the puzzle.

meanings.definition: Cause (something desired or anticipated) to happen.
meanings.sent1: Her hard work realised success in the end.
meanings.sent2: The magician realised his trick perfectly, amazing the audience.
meanings.sent3: The chef realised a delicious meal with simple ingredients.
meanings.sent4: The team captain realised victory with a last-minute goal.
meanings.sent5: The artist realised her vision on the canvas with vibrant colors.

meanings.sent1: They realised their savings to buy a new car.
meanings.sent2: The company realised a profit by selling its old equipment.
meanings.sent3: The farmer realised his crops to pay off debts.
meanings.sent4: She realised her inheritance to invest in a business.
meanings.sent5: He realised his stocks to fund his dream vacation.
